Browse the source code of qv2ray/3rdparty/QNodeEditor/src/NodeConnectionInteraction.cpp

1#include "NodeConnectionInteraction.hpp"
2
3#include "ConnectionGraphicsObject.hpp"
4#include "DataModelRegistry.hpp"
5#include "FlowScene.hpp"
6#include "NodeDataModel.hpp"
7#include "NodeGraphicsObject.hpp"
8using QtNodes::Connection;
9using QtNodes::FlowScene;
10using QtNodes::Node;
11using QtNodes::NodeConnectionInteraction;
12using QtNodes::NodeDataModel;
13using QtNodes::PortIndex;
14using QtNodes::PortType;
15using QtNodes::TypeConverter;
16NodeConnectionInteraction::NodeConnectionInteraction(Node &node, Connection &connection, FlowScene &scene)
17 : _node(&node), _connection(&connection), _scene(&scene)
18{
19}
20bool NodeConnectionInteraction::canConnect(PortIndex &portIndex, TypeConverter &converter) const
21{
22 // 1) Connection requires a port
23 PortType requiredPort = connectionRequiredPort();
24 if (requiredPort == PortType::None)
25 {
26 return false;
27 }
28 // 1.5) Forbid connecting the node to itself
29 Node *node = _connection->getNode(oppositePort(requiredPort));
30 if (node == _node)
31 return false;
32 // 2) connection point is on top of the node port
33 QPointF connectionPoint = connectionEndScenePosition(requiredPort);
34 portIndex = nodePortIndexUnderScenePoint(requiredPort, connectionPoint);
35 if (portIndex == INVALID)
36 {
37 return false;
38 }
39 // 3) Node port is vacant
40 // port should be empty
41 if (!nodePortIsEmpty(requiredPort, portIndex))
42 return false;
43 // 4) Connection type equals node port type, or there is a registered type
44 // conversion that can translate between the two
45 auto connectionDataType = _connection->dataType(oppositePort(requiredPort));
46 auto const &modelTarget = _node->nodeDataModel();
47 auto candidateNodeDataType = modelTarget->dataType(requiredPort, portIndex);
48 if (*connectionDataType != *candidateNodeDataType)
49 {
50 if (requiredPort == PortType::In)
51 {
52 converter = _scene->registry().getTypeConverter(connectionDataType->id(), candidateNodeDataType->id());
53 }
54 else if (requiredPort == PortType::Out)
55 {
56 converter = _scene->registry().getTypeConverter(candidateNodeDataType->id(), connectionDataType->id());
57 }
58 return (converter != nullptr);
59 }
60 return true;
61}
62bool NodeConnectionInteraction::tryConnect() const
63{
64 // 1) Check conditions from 'canConnect'
65 PortIndex portIndex = INVALID;
66 TypeConverter converter;
67 if (!canConnect(portIndex, converter))
68 {
69 return false;
70 }
71 // 1.5) If the connection is possible but a type conversion is needed,
72 // assign a convertor to connection
73 if (converter)
74 {
75 _connection->setTypeConverter(converter);
76 }
77 // 2) Assign node to required port in Connection
78 PortType requiredPort = connectionRequiredPort();
79 _node->nodeState().setConnection(requiredPort, portIndex, *_connection);
80 // 3) Assign Connection to empty port in NodeState
81 // The port is not longer required after this function
82 _connection->setNodeToPort(*_node, requiredPort, portIndex);
83 // 4) Adjust Connection geometry
84 _node->nodeGraphicsObject().moveConnections();
85 // 5) Poke model to intiate data transfer
86 auto outNode = _connection->getNode(PortType::Out);
87 if (outNode)
88 {
89 PortIndex outPortIndex = _connection->getPortIndex(PortType::Out);
90 outNode->onDataUpdated(outPortIndex);
91 }
92 return true;
93}
94/// 1) Node and Connection should be already connected
95/// 2) If so, clear Connection entry in the NodeState
96/// 3) Set Connection end to 'requiring a port'
97bool NodeConnectionInteraction::disconnect(PortType portToDisconnect) const
98{
99 PortIndex portIndex = _connection->getPortIndex(portToDisconnect);
100 NodeState &state = _node->nodeState();
101 // clear pointer to Connection in the NodeState
102 state.getEntries(portToDisconnect)[portIndex].erase(_connection->id());
103 // 4) Propagate invalid data to IN node
104 _connection->propagateEmptyData();
105 // clear Connection side
106 _connection->clearNode(portToDisconnect);
107 _connection->setRequiredPort(portToDisconnect);
108 _connection->getConnectionGraphicsObject().grabMouse();
109 return true;
110}
111// ------------------ util functions below
112PortType NodeConnectionInteraction::connectionRequiredPort() const
113{
114 auto const &state = _connection->connectionState();
115 return state.requiredPort();
116}
117QPointF NodeConnectionInteraction::connectionEndScenePosition(PortType portType) const
118{
119 auto &go = _connection->getConnectionGraphicsObject();
120 ConnectionGeometry &geometry = _connection->connectionGeometry();
121 QPointF endPoint = geometry.getEndPoint(portType);
122 return go.mapToScene(endPoint);
123}
124QPointF NodeConnectionInteraction::nodePortScenePosition(PortType portType, PortIndex portIndex) const
125{
126 NodeGeometry const &geom = _node->nodeGeometry();
127 QPointF p = geom.portScenePosition(portIndex, portType);
128 NodeGraphicsObject &ngo = _node->nodeGraphicsObject();
129 return ngo.sceneTransform().map(p);
130}
131PortIndex NodeConnectionInteraction::nodePortIndexUnderScenePoint(PortType portType, QPointF const &scenePoint) const
132{
133 NodeGeometry const &nodeGeom = _node->nodeGeometry();
134 QTransform sceneTransform = _node->nodeGraphicsObject().sceneTransform();
135 PortIndex portIndex = nodeGeom.checkHitScenePoint(portType, scenePoint, sceneTransform);
136 return portIndex;
137}
138bool NodeConnectionInteraction::nodePortIsEmpty(PortType portType, PortIndex portIndex) const
139{
140 if (portType == PortType::None)
141 {
142 return false;
143 }
144 NodeState const &nodeState = _node->nodeState();
145 auto const &entries = nodeState.getEntries(portType);
146 if (entries[portIndex].empty())
147 return true;
148 if (portType == PortType::In)
149 return _node->nodeDataModel()->portInConnectionPolicy(portIndex) == NodeDataModel::ConnectionPolicy::Many;
150 return _node->nodeDataModel()->portOutConnectionPolicy(portIndex) == NodeDataModel::ConnectionPolicy::Many;
151}
